claims: There are two primary types of cache used in caching implementations: write-through and write-back caches.

Write-back caches only update the cache initially upon data modification and defer the updating of the main memory until absolutely necessary, enhancing write performance.
However, this approach may lead to potential data inconsistency if not properly managed.
